question: For the reaction <katex>$2N_{2}O_{5(g)} \rightarrow 4NO_{2(g)}+O_{2(g)}$</katex> initial concentration of <katex>$N_{2}O_{5}$</katex> is <katex>$2.0 mol L^{-1}$</katex> and after 300 min, it is reduced to <katex>$1.4 mol L^{-1}$</katex>. The rate of production of <katex>$NO_{2}$</katex> (in <katex>$mol L^{-1} min^{-1}$</katex>) is
explanation: Rate of production of <katex>$NO_2$</katex> is 2 times rate of <katex>$N_2O_5$</katex> (stoichiometry 4 vs 2).
